sen.j: 酒井 忠績（さかい ただしげ）は、江戸時代末期の大名、老中、大老。
sen.e: Tadashige SAKAI was a Daimyo, Roju (member of shogun's council of elders) and Tairo (chief minister) in the later Edo Period.
Tadashige SAKAI was a Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord), Roju (member of shogun's council of elders) and Tairo (chief minister) in the later Edo Period.
Tadashige SAKAI was a Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord), Roju (member of shogun's council of elders) and Tairo (chief minister) in the later Edo Period.

sen.j: 男爵。
sen.e: Baron.
Baron.
Baron.

sen.j: 播磨国姫路藩第8代藩主。
sen.e: Eighth Hanshu (Lord) of Harima Province, Himeji Domain
The eighth lord of Himeji Domain in Harima Province.
The eighth lord of Himeji Domain in Harima Province.

sen.j: 雅楽頭系酒井家宗家16代。
sen.e: Sixteenth Family Head of the Sakai family, Uta no kami (Director of the Bureau of Music) branch.
The sixteenth load of the Sakai family, the Utano kami line
The sixteenth load of the Sakai family, the Utano kami line

sen.j: 生涯
sen.e: Life
Biography
Biography

sen.j: 忠績は姫路藩分家旗本5000石の酒井忠誨の長男であるが、姫路藩藩主酒井忠顕に子がないため、本家の養子となる。
sen.e: Tadashige was the first son of Tadataka SAKAI, a hatamoto (direct retainer of the bakufu, which is a form of Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) with 5000 koku from the Himeji Domain branch family, but became the main branch's foster child because the Himeji Domain Hanshu Tadaaki SAKAI did not have any biological children.

Tadashige was the first son of Tadanori SAKAI, a hatamoto (direct retainer of the bakufu, which is a form of Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) with 5000 koku from the Himeji Domain branch family, but became the main branch's foster child because the lord of Himeji Domain Tadateru SAKAI did not have any biological children.

Tadashige was the first son of Tadanori SAKAI, a hatamoto (direct retainer of the bakufu, which is a form of Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) with 5000 koku from the Himeji Domain branch family, but became the main branch's foster child because the lord of Himeji Domain Tadateru SAKAI did not have any biological children.

sen.j: 万延元年（1860年）家督を相続する。
sen.e: He succeeded as family head in 1860.
He succeeded as family head in 1860.
He succeeded as family head in 1860.

sen.j: 文久2年（1862年）、忠績は幕命により上洛した。
sen.e: Tadashige went to Kyoto at the orders of the bakufu in 1862.
Tadashige went to Kyoto at the orders of the bakufu in 1862.
Tadashige went to Kyoto at the orders of the bakufu in 1862.

sen.j: 京都守衛と京都所司代臨時代行の特命を帯びての入京であった。
sen.e: He entered Kyoto with special orders as Kyoto Guard and temporary substitute of the Kyoto Shoshidai (Kyoto deputy)
He entered Kyoto with special orders as Kyoto Guard and temporary substitute of the Kyoto Shoshidai (Kyoto deputy)
He entered Kyoto with special orders as Kyoto Guard and temporary substitute of the Kyoto Shoshidai (Kyoto deputy)

sen.j: 安政の大獄期に京都所司代に就任した酒井忠義 (若狭国小浜藩主)（小浜藩主）は、井伊直弼暗殺後も引き続きその職にあり、罷免を朝廷から要求されていた。
sen.e: Tadayoshi SAKAI (Wakasa Province, Obama Hanshu), who was appointed as Kyoto Shoshidai during the Ansei no Taigoku (suppression of extremists by the Shogunate) period, stayed at the post even after the assassination of Naosuke II and his dismissal was being requested by the Imperial court.

Tadayoshi SAKAI (the lord of Obama Domain in Wakasa Province), who had been appointed as Kyoto Shoshidai during the Ansei no Taigoku (suppression of extremists by the Shogunate) period, stayed at the post even after the assassination of Naosuke II and his dismissal was being requested by the Imperial court.
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一who was → who had been
sen.e: Tadayoshi SAKAI (the lord of Obama Domain in Wakasa Province), who had been appointed as Kyoto Shoshidai during the Ansei no Taigoku (suppression of extremists by the Shogunate) period, stayed at the post even after the assassination of Naosuke II and his dismissal was being requested by the Imperial court.

sen.j: 幕府は忠義を罷免し、後任として大坂城代松平宗秀を内定したが、宗秀も安政の大獄当時は寺社奉行の任にあり、しかも井伊直弼の信任が非常に厚かったため、朝廷は宗秀の所司代就任にも内諾を与えなかった。
sen.e: The bakufu had dismissed Tadayoshi and tentatively appointed Osaka Castle keeper Munehide MATSUDAIRA as his successor, but the Imperial court refused to approve the appointment because Munehide was also a Jishabugyo during the Ansei no Taigoku and especially favored by Naosuke II.

The bakufu had dismissed Tadayoshi and tentatively appointed Osaka Castle keeper Munehide MATSUDAIRA as his successor, but the Imperial court refused to approve the appointment because Munehide was also a Jishabugyo during the Ansei no Taigoku and especially favored by Naosuke II.

The bakufu had dismissed Tadayoshi and tentatively appointed Osaka Castle keeper Munehide MATSUDAIRA as his successor, but the Imperial court refused to approve the appointment because Munehide was also a Jishabugyo during the Ansei no Taigoku and especially favored by Naosuke II.

sen.j: このため所司代は空席という、開幕以来の異常な事態となっていた。
sen.e: Therefore, the Shoshidai position was left open, which was an abnormal situation that had never happened before in the history of the bakufu.
Therefore, the Shoshidai position was left open, which was an abnormal situation that had never happened before in the history of the bakufu.
Therefore, the Shoshidai position was left open, which was an abnormal situation that had never happened before in the history of the bakufu.

sen.j: このため、9月末に牧野忠恭が後任の京都所司代として正式に承認されるまで4ヶ月間その任にあたった。
sen.e: Tadashige was in charge of the job for 4 months until Tadayuki MAKINO was officially approved as Kyoto Shoshidai at the end of September.
Tadashige was in charge of the job for 4 months until Tadayuki MAKINO was officially approved as Kyoto Shoshidai at the end of September.
Tadashige was in charge of the job for 4 months until Tadayuki MAKINO was officially approved as Kyoto Shoshidai at the end of September.

sen.j: 京都市中警備の功績により、文久3年（1863年）、老中首座となる。
sen.e: He became the top ranking Roju in 1863 due to his achievements as Kyoto City Guard.
He became the top ranking Roju in 1863 due to his achievements as Kyoto City Guard.
He became the top ranking Roju in 1863 due to his achievements as Kyoto City Guard.

sen.j: 老中就任後は兵庫開港をめぐって朝廷対策に奔走する一方、年末に家茂の上洛が決定すると、御三家の徳川慶篤、忍藩侯の松平忠誠 (武蔵国忍藩主)とともに江戸留守居役を命じられる。
sen.e: After becoming appointed as Roju, he negotiated with the Imperial court over the opening of Hyogo Port and he was ordered to be in charge of taking care of Edo together with one of the Gosanke (three privileged branches of Tokugawa family)members, Yoshiatsu TOKUGAWA and Tadashige MATSUDAIRA (Musashi Province, Oshi Domain) of the Shinobu Domain while Iemochi was to go to Kyoto at the end of the year.

After taking office as Roju, he negotiated with the Imperial court over the opening of Hyogo Port and in the meantime, he was ordered to be in charge of taking care of Edo, together with one of the Gosanke (three privileged branches of Tokugawa family) members, Yoshiatsu TOKUGAWA and Tadashige MATSUDAIRA (the lord of Oshi Domain in Musashi Province) of the Oshi Domain, while Iemochi was to go to Kyoto at the end of the year.
sen.cmt: becoming appointed → taking officeand in the meantimeを追加Shinobu → Oshiカンマを追加
sen.e: After taking office as Roju, he negotiated with the Imperial court over the opening of Hyogo Port and in the meantime, he was ordered to be in charge of taking care of Edo, together with one of the Gosanke (three privileged branches of Tokugawa family) members, Yoshiatsu TOKUGAWA and Tadashige MATSUDAIRA (the lord of Oshi Domain in Musashi Province) of the Oshi Domain, while Iemochi was to go to Kyoto at the end of the year.

sen.j: ちょうど一年後に老中を退いたが、8ヶ月後には大老となった。
sen.e: He retired from being Roju in just one year, but became Tairo after 8months.
He retired from being Roju in just one year, but became Tairo (chief minister) after 8months.
He retired from being Roju in just one year, but became Tairo (chief minister) after 8months.

sen.j: そして第2次長州征伐の事後処理、幕府軍の西洋式軍制の導入など、幕政改革に尽力した。
sen.e: He worked for Bakufu reforms such as the post-war management of the Second Conquest of Choshu and introduction of western-style military system into the bakufu troops.
He worked for Bakufu reforms such as the post-war management of the Second Conquest of Choshu and introduction of western-style military system into the bakufu troops.
He worked for Bakufu reforms such as the post-war management of the Second Conquest of Choshu and introduction of western-style military system into the bakufu troops.

sen.j: 慶応3年（1867年）2月、隠居し、養子酒井忠惇に家督を譲る。
sen.e: He retired in February 1867 and relinquished the family head position to his foster child, Tadaatsu SAKAI.
He retired in February 1867 and relinquished the family head position to his foster child, Tadaatsu SAKAI.
He retired in February 1867 and relinquished the family head position to his foster child, Tadaatsu SAKAI.

sen.j: 明治3年（1870年）2月、静岡藩士酒井忠恕方への同居を認められる。
sen.e: He was allowed to live with Shizuoka Hanshi (domain retainer) Tadahiro SAKAI in February 1870.
He was allowed to live with Shizuoka Hanshi (domain retainer) Tadahiro SAKAI in February 1870.
He was allowed to live with Shizuoka Hanshi (domain retainer) Tadahiro SAKAI in February 1870.

sen.j: 明治13年11月、終身華族に列する。
sen.e: He was raised to peerage for one generation in November 1880.
He was raised to peerage for one generation in November 1880.
He was raised to peerage for one generation in November 1880.

sen.j: 明治22年5月、永世華族に列し、男爵を授けられる。
sen.e: He was raised to peerage in 1889 and given the position of Baron.
He was raised to permanent peerage in 1889 and given the position of Baron.
He was raised to permanent peerage in 1889 and given the position of Baron.

1827: Birth
1827: Birth

sen.j: 1860年（万延元年） ：忠顕、没（10月14日 (旧暦)）。
sen.e: 1860: Tadaaki dies (October 14 (lunar calendar)).
1860: Tadateru died (November 26).
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一旧暦日付 → 西暦
sen.e: 1860: Tadateru died (November 26).

sen.j: 12月9日 (旧暦)、遺領を継ぐ。
sen.e: December 9 (lunar calendar) inherits his lands.
January 19, 1861, inherited his properties.
sen.cmt: 旧暦日付 → 西暦過去時制
sen.e: January 19, 1861, inherited his properties.

sen.j: 1862年（文久2年） ：忠績上京し（5月）、京都所司代臨時代行（～9月末まで）。
sen.e: 1862: Tadashige goes to Kyoto (May), temporary substitute as Kyoto Shoshidai (until end of September).
1862: Tadashige went to Kyoto (May), temporary substitute as Kyoto Shoshidai (until end of September).
1862: Tadashige went to Kyoto (May), temporary substitute as Kyoto Shoshidai (until end of September).

sen.j: 1863年（文久3年） ：老中となり（6月18日 (旧暦)）、直ちに上座とされる。
sen.e: 1863: Tadashige becomes Roju (June 18 (lunar calendar) and immediately appointed to the top-rank.
1863: Tadashige became Roju (August 2) and immediately appointed to the top-rank.
sen.cmt: 旧暦日付 → 西暦過去時制
sen.e: 1863: Tadashige became Roju (August 2) and immediately appointed to the top-rank.

sen.j: 家茂上洛（12月28日 (旧暦)）。
sen.e: Iemochi goes to Kyoto (December 28 (lunar calendar)).
Iemochi went to Kyoto (February 5, 1864).

sen.e: Iemochi went to Kyoto (February 5, 1864).

sen.j: 1864年（元治元年） ：老中免職（6月18日 (旧暦)）。
sen.e: 1864: Retires from Roju post (June 18 (lunar calendar)).
1864: Retired from Roju post (July 21).

sen.e: 1864: Retired from Roju post (July 21).

sen.e: 1865: Becomes Tairo (February 1(lunar calendar)).
1865: Became Tairo (January 6).

sen.e: 1865: Became Tairo (January 6).

sen.e: 1865: Retires from Tairo post (November 12(lunar calendar)).
1865: Retired from Tairo post (December 29).

sen.e: 1865: Retired from Tairo post (December 29).

1867: Retired from public life (April 2).

sen.e: 1867: Retired from public life (April 2).

sen.j: 1889年（明治21年） ：男爵（3月2日 (旧暦)）
sen.e: 1889: Becomes a Baron (March 2(lunar calendar)).
1889: Became a Baron (April 1).

sen.j: 1895年（明治27年） ：死去、享年69
sen.e: 1895: Dies at the age of sixty-nine.
1895: Died at the age of sixty-nine.
